papers.title: Patterns of Cannabis and Alcohol Co-Use: Substitution Versus Complementary Effects
Comparing and Prioritizing Different Methods of Collection and Decontamination of Waste in Decentralized Healthcare Centers
papers.authors: , Fatemeh Ostadi, Fatemeh Mortezazadeh,  , Fathollah Gholami-Borujeni,
papers.journal: Journal of Advances in Environmental Health Research
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Background: One of the most critical problems in the safe management of healthcare wastes is using different methods in decentralized centers in Iran. This study aimed to compare and prioritize different methods of collection and decontamination of healthcare waste in decentralized health centers in Iran. Methods: In this descriptive-analytical research, we studied various methods of collecting and decontaminating the healthcare waste of decentralized healthcare centers in Iran in terms of administrative, health, economic and environmental. Also, the opinions and the preferences of experts for selecting each method were collected and analyzed. Results: According to environmental health experts, health issues had the highest priority for decontamination of waste from decentralized health centers. Waste collection by special vehicles with the help of the private sector and transfer to centralized disinfection centers is the best method of collecting waste (33%). Also, decontamination by autoclave was the most desirable method (56%) of decontamination. According to the experts‚Äô opinions, landfilling is the most harmful, and autoclave/hydroclave is the least harmful method to the climate and soil. Based on the environmental health experts, the health aspect was the most important priority in waste management of decentralized healthcare centers (54%). Conclusion: The most appropriate way to decontaminate this type of waste is autoclaving after collection at a centralized location. It is suggested that further studies be conducted on modern collection and disinfection systems along with localization and determination of workplace health policies.</jats:p>

papers.title: Studying the Effluent Quality of Enhanced Modified Ludzack Ettinger-oxic Settling Anaerobic Process (E-MLE-OSA) for Treating Real Municipal Wastewater
papers.authors: , Behzad Nikpour, Reza Jalilzadeh Yengejeh,  , Afshin Takdastan,  , Amir Hessam Hassani,  , Mohammad Ali Zazouli,
papers.journal: Journal of Advances in Environmental Health Research
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Background: Wastewater collection, treatment, discharge, additionally as reusing the treated wastewater in urban are critical factors for maintaining public health preventing contamination of water resources. This study aimed to investigate the performance of enhanced modified Ludzack Ettinger process-oxic settling anaerobic (MLE-OSA) process for treating real municipal wastewater in Sari wastewater Treatment, Sari City, Iran. Methods: To combine the OSA process technique with the MLE system, the Sludge Holding Tanks (SHT) were implemented in the return sludge line of designed pilot studies which comprised 1) MLE, which was regarded as the control system similar; 2) MLE-OSA4 with a 70-L SHT operated at 4-h Hydraulic Retention Time (HRT), and 3) MLEOSA6 with a 107-L SHT operated at 6-h HRT. To start the process, the overflow effluent of the primary settling tank of the Sari wastewater treatment plant was used. After 45-60 days, the reactors reached a steady state. The parameters of Dissolved Oxygen (DO), Oxidation-Reduction Potential (ORP), temperature, pH, Chemical Oxygen Demand (COD), Biochemical Oxygen Demand (BOD5), Total Suspended Solids (TSS), and nutrients were analyzed. Results: The results revealed that the average TSS, COD, BOD, phosphorus, nitrite, nitrate, and total nitrogen in MLEOSA4 effluent decreased 20.1, 14.6, 2.97, 10, 51.1, 19.3, and 20.7%, respectively compared to MLE. Similarly, in MLE-OSA6, the values decreased 34.2, 16.1, 14.6, 16.7, 69.6, 31.3, and 25.8%, respectively compared to the control process. Conclusion: Therefore, using natural wastewater, the enhanced MLE-OSA process showed better performance in removing the study parameters and better quality for the effluent. Furthermore, the quality of effluent is following the Iran Department of Environment (IDE).</jats:p>

papers.title: Effect of Drought Stress, Soil Salinity, P. indica, and MWCNs on Biodegradation of Diesel Oil in the Pb- and Cd-Polluted Soil Under Cultivation of Triticale Plant
papers.journal: Journal of Advances in Environmental Health Research
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Background: Today, soil pollution with heavy metals and petroleum compounds is one of the main environmental problems. This research was done to investigate the effect of drought stress, soil salinity, Piriformospora indica (P. indica), and MWCNs on biodegradation of diesel oil in the soil that contaminated with Pb and Cd under cultivation of triticale plant. Methods: Treatments consisted of applying MWCNs (2% [W/W]) in the Pb- and Cd-polluted soil that was simultaneously polluted with diesel oil (0, 5, and 10% [W/W]), and the plants used in this study were inoculated with P. indica. After 70 days, plants were harvested, and plant and soil Cd were measured using AAS (atomic absorption spectrometry). In addition, the degradation percentage of diesel oil in soil was determined. Results: Soil application of MWCNs at the rate of 2% (W/W) significantly increased the biodegradation of diesel oil in the soil in the drought and salinity (6 dS/m) stress by 11.3% and 15.6%, respectively. In addition, plant inoculation with P. indica significantly increased the biodegradation of diesel oil in the soil by 12.3%. For salinity (6 dS/m) and drought stress, it was increased by 8.3% and 9.4%, respectively. In addition, the Pb and Cd concentrations decreased by 14.3% and 12.8%, respectively, when the MWCNs were added to the soil (2% [W/W]). Conclusion: Soil application of MWCNs and plant inoculation with P. indica not only increased the biodegradation of diesel oil but also decreased the plant Pb and Cd concentrations.</jats:p>

papers.title: Assessment of Human Health Risk and Surface Soil Contamination by Some Toxic Elements in Arak City, Iran
papers.authors: , Meghdad Bineshpour, Khoshnaz Payandeh,  , Ahad Nazarpour,  , Sima Sabzalipour,
papers.journal: Journal of Advances in Environmental Health Research
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Background: Population growth, numerous factories, and many vehicles are the primary sources of environmental pollution and toxic elements in the industrial city of Arak, Iran. Methods: In June 2016, a total of 30 toxic element samples were taken from surface soils to examine their contents of lead (Pb), Zinc (Zn), Copper (Cu), Nickel (Ni), Arsenic (As), Chromium (Cr), and Cadmium (Cd). The samples were collected from 0 to 20 cm depth and measured using Atomic Absorption Spectroscopy (AAS) (PG990 Model). Results: The results showed that the mean concentrations of all toxic elements except arsenic had a higher value than the background values in the world. The Top Enrichment Factor (TEF) of toxic elements of nickel, chromium, lead, and copper was higher than other elements. The Potential Ecological Risk (PER) index showed high and very high risk for the elements. For all elements, the Hazard Index (HI) values were higher for children than for adults. Moreover, the results of carcinogenic health risk assessment (Carcinogenicity Risk [CR]) of the toxic elements for Cr in children with an average value of 0.001 and adults with an average value of 3.81e-04 showed that the CR of chromium for children poses a serious threat to the health of children and adults. Conclusion: In general, the toxic element pollution for the surface soil of Arak is of concern, and significant measures should be taken to reduce the pollutants.</jats:p>

papers.title: Comparing the Performance Evaluation Models of Gas Refineries Using AHP and TOPSIS
papers.authors: , Mahmoud Mohammadi, Saber Ghasemi,  , Hossein Parvaresh,  , Mohsen Dehghani Ghanateghestani,
papers.journal: Journal of Advances in Environmental Health Research
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Background: To basically solve the critical environmental problems, macro and infrastructural perspectives of rational development should be designed following environmental protection rules. Creating the proper performance measurement systems in every organization has had a promising interest in university studies, and many researchers are working on it. Methods: This research intends to compare and rank 4 evaluation performance models used in gas refineries. To achieve the desired model in this study, we employed the grounded theory. The study research consisted of 20 professionals and Health, Safety, and Environmental (HSE) managers of gas refineries who had relevant experience and skills in this area. The normal score was estimated based on the weight obtained from the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) to apply the Technique for Order Preference by Similarity to an Ideal Solution (TOPSIS) process and prioritize the models. Results: The pairwise comparison matrix of 4 research models of the balanced scoring card, European foundation for quality management business excellence model, Iran national quality award, and environmental performance evaluation depicted that the geometric mean of the evaluation criteria includes the following items: the capability to quantify qualitative data for environmental performance, facilitating, efficient implementing, structuring, and mapping a roadmap of organization maturity to select an environmental performance estimated at 1.22, 0.90, 0.95, and 0.96, respectively. Also, the normal weights of these four criteria are estimated at 0.3039423, 0.2242449, 0.2347026, and 0.2371102, respectively. Conclusion: The findings resulting from prioritizing the organization‚Äôs Environmental Performance Evaluation (EPE) models based on TOPSIS depicted that the suggested model with relative proximity to 99% is the first choice of EPE for the gas refinery.</jats:p>

papers.title: A Simplified Approach to Evaluate Retinal Blue Light Hazard Using the Correlated Color Temperature of LED Light Sources
papers.authors: , Farough Mohammadian, Ahmad Mehri,  , Kamaladdin Abedi,  , Hossein Ebrahimi,  , Fereydoon Laal,  , Hamed Falahi,
papers.journal: Journal of Advances in Environmental Health Research
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Background: Visible light of short wavelength (blue light) can damage the retina cells, called blue light hazard. To protect the retina, permissible exposure limits have been determined by ICNIRP (the International Commission on Non-Ionizing Radiation Protection) and other health and safety agencies. These limits include complex physical concepts, and their evaluation requires light measuring instruments equipped with a blue light hazard function filter, which is not available at the moment in developing countries. This study aims to assess retinal blue light hazard using the correlated color temperature of Light-Emitting Diode (LED) light sources. Methods: In this study, a new method was proposed for evaluating the retinal blue light hazard using only the Correlated Color Temperature (CCL) of LED light sources for which concern on blue light hazard has currently been reinforced. In the proposed method, the radiometric quantity (blue light effective radiance) in W.m-2.sr-1 was converted to the corresponding photometric quantity (blue light effective luminance) in lm.m-2.sr-1. Then a computer code was developed for relevant calculations. Results: The estimated permissible exposure times applying the new photometry approach were highly reliable and supported by the literature. The proposed method is particularly useful because it eliminates the need to utilize any light measuring device. Conclusion: The new approach makes the concept of blue light hazard straightforward and understandable for all specialists dealing with optical radiation safety.</jats:p>

papers.title: Investigating the Non-carcinogenic Risk and Hazard Quotient of Heavy Metals in High-traffic Districts of Tehran Metropolis, Iran
papers.authors: , Azam Mahdipour, Mojgan Zaeimdar,  , Mohammad Sadegh Sekhavatjou,  , Sayed Ali Jozi,
papers.journal: Journal of Advances in Environmental Health Research
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Background: This study aimed to investigate the concentrations of heavy metals bound to airborne Particulate Matter (PM) in high-traffic districts of Tehran, Iran, and to determine the carcinogenic risk and Hazard Quotient (HQ) of these metals using a descriptive-applied method. Methods: Six indoor/outdoor stations were established in three high-traffic districts of Tehran. Each station was sampled with six replicates in winter 2018 (36 samples in total). After extracting the metals from fiberglass filters by acid digestion based on the ASTM (the American Society for Testing and Materials method), the concentrations of heavy metals were determined by an Inductively Coupled Plasma (ICP-OES) device. The human health risk was evaluated according to the US EPA (Environmental Protection Agency) standard method. The obtained data were analyzed by the Spearman correlation and Multivariate Analysis of Variance (MANOVA) in SPSS. Results: Districts 2, 3, and then 15 were the most high-traffic areas of Tehran in descending order. Average heavy metal concentrations were detected in order of Al>Fe>Pb>Mn>Cu>Zn>Cr>As>Ni>Cd. Also, the heavy metals concentrations were significantly different between indoor and outdoor environments. The correlations between heavy metal concentrations, carcinogenic risk, and HQ were significant in all three districts (P<0.05). Mean carcinogenic risk variables, HQ levels, and heavy metal concentrations in all three regions were in order of districts 15>2>3 and outdoors>indoors. Conclusion: Based on the results, serious measures are recommended to control traffic congestion in Tehran to prevent cancer risk and other health hazards caused by heavy metal bonded TSP (total suspended particulate matter).</jats:p>

papers.title: Investigation and Optimization of Air Pollution Risk by a Multi-criteria Decision Making Method Using Fuzzy TOPSIS: A Case Study of Construction Workers
papers.journal: Journal of Advances in Environmental Health Research
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Background: Investigating human health during work importantly affect the safety and efficiency of the society. Different types of activity, including industrial, constructional, heavy duty ones, etc., affect the health of workers during their activities. In this study, the Multi-Objective Decision-Making (MODM) method was combined with fuzzy TOPSIS to investigate and optimize the air pollution risk affecting the health and safety of construction workers of Lar City, Fars Province, Iran. Methods: The comparison matrices (binary) and the Phillips‚ÄìPerron test of different criteria and sub-criteria of health risk, including safety view, safety efficiency, understanding the risk, and risk investigation, were assessed to find the most influential factors for the optimization of the health risk of the workers. Results: Accordingly, the results indicated that ‚Äúunderstanding the risk‚Äù followed by ‚Äúsafety efficiency‚Äù affected the health risk of the construction workers the most. However, among the sub-criteria, the most effective ones were ‚Äúworker knowledge‚Äù, ‚Äúmanager knowledge‚Äù, ‚Äúlogistic specialized managers‚Äù, ‚Äúmodern facilities‚Äù, and ‚Äúmodern technology‚Äù. The selection of the linear and non-linear models was conducted according to the F values, and the model parameters were estimated using the Newton-Raphson test. Most coefficients were significant at P= 0.99. The model also has a high describing value of 0.97. The final estimated homogeneity coefficient was equal to 1.31, and it ranged from 0.86 to 2.72 for the critical risk investigation. The significance of the present research is to increase the health and safety of workers during work resulting in a more sustainable and healthier environment. Conclusion: Accordingly, the managers could handle the risks, determine the tolerable risks, indicate the risk of each process to control expenses, and take the essential measures for optimization.</jats:p>

papers.title: The Effects of Relaxing Music on Life Distress and Maternal-fetal Attachment in Pregnant Women
papers.authors: , Mona Shokri Shams, Anahita Khodabakhshi-Koolaee,  , Mohammad Reza Falsafinejad,
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Background: Although pregnancy and motherhood are enjoyable experiences, they are associated with numerous biopsychological changes requiring adaptation. The present study aimed to assess the effects of relaxing music on life distress and Maternal-Fetal Attachment (MFA) in pregnant women. Methods: This was a quasi-experimental study with a pre-test, post-test and a control group design. The research population included all Iranian pregnant women referring to Laleh Hospital in Tehran City, Iran, in 2020. In total, 30 women were selected using the convenience sampling method and randomly assigned into the intervention and control groups (n=15/group). The required data were collected using the Life Distress Inventory (LDI) and the Maternal-Fetal Attachment Scale (MFAS). The intervention group listened to relaxing music for twelve 45-50-minute sessions in the morning and during routine midwifery visits; however, the controls received no intervention. The collected data were analyzed using Multivariate Analysis of Covariance (MANCOVA) in SPSS V. 22. Results: The obtained results indicated that the intervention group reported a lower level of life distress in the post-test, compared to the controls (P=0.0001, F=15.860). The intervention group also achieved a higher mean score on MFA, than the control group (P=0.0001, F=35.872).  Conclusion: According to the present research findings, reproductive health, nursing professionals, and psychologists could recommend music as a complementary therapy to reduce stress and distress experienced by expecting mothers and to improve MFA.</jats:p>

Trends and Strategies in Implementing RME and PJBL for Teaching Central Tendency: A Systematic Literature Review
papers.authors: Allen Marga Retta, Ratu Ilma Indra Putri, Zulkardi Zulkardi, Ely Susanti
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Penelitian ini bertujuan untuk mengkaji tren penelitian terkini dan strategi yang paling efektif untuk mendukung kemampuan berpikir kritis siswa pada materi ukuran pemusatan data. Metode yang digunakan adalah Systematic Literature Review (SLR) dengan mengumpulkan artikel-artikel yang relevan dari tahun 2018 hingga 2025, yang mengkaji tren dan strategi dalam konteks pembelajaran ukuran pemusatan data. Artikel-artikel yang relevan dikumpulkan dari berbagai basis data akademik terkemuka, seperti Scopus dan Google Scholar, dengan menggunakan kata kunci yang berkaitan dengan Realistic Mathematics Education (RME), Project Based Learning (PjBL), dan ukuran pemusatan data. Proses seleksi inklusi dilakukan dengan menyaring 1383 artikel yang relevan menjadi 175 artikel, dan setelah pemeriksaan lebih lanjut, 147 artikel dieliminasi berdasarkan kriteria relevansi. Akhirnya, 15 artikel dipilih untuk analisis lebih lanjut. Hasil utama penelitian ini menunjukkan bahwa RME dan PjBL menjadi dua pendekatan yang semakin populer dari tahun 2018 hingga 2025 dalam pengajaran ukuran pemusatan di kalangan peneliti, dengan strategi penggunaan konteks dunia nyata, proyek berbasis pembelajaran, dan integrasi teknologi dan etnomatematika dalam mendukung kemampuan berpikir kritis siswa.</jats:p>

papers.authors: Mohammed Benlemlih, Elias Erragragui, V√©ronique Blum, Saria Awadallah
papers.abstract: <jats:p>L‚Äôarticle analyse le r√¥le mod√©rateur des modes de r√©gulation et de gouvernance publique et en particulier l‚Äôefficacit√© des pouvoirs publics et de l‚Äô√âtat de droit dans la relation entre la communication RSE et la performance financi√®re des entreprises. En s‚Äôappuyant sur les travaux examinant la compl√©mentarit√© entre hard et soft law , notre √©tude se propose d‚Äô√©clairer la mani√®re dont l‚Äôimplication des pouvoirs publics dans l‚Äôencadrement des acteurs priv√©s influence leur perception du r√¥le instrumental de la communication RSE. √Ä partir de donn√©es recueillies aupr√®s d‚Äôun √©chantillon d‚Äôentreprises internationales totalisant 11743 observations couvrant 30 pays entre 2007 et 2018, notre analyse empirique montre que la relation entre la communication de l‚Äôinformation RSE et la performance financi√®re des entreprises appara√Æt plus significative dans les pays caract√©ris√©s par une faible efficacit√© des pouvoirs publics et un √âtat de droit plus fort. Nos r√©sultats indiquent que la perception des acteurs priv√©s d'un faible leadership de la gouvernance publique est de nature √† les inciter √† davantage consid√©rer la qualit√© de l'information RSE comme un levier strat√©gique de performance dans une logique substitutive de la hard law par la soft law .</jats:p>

The Effect of Conflict and Termination of Employment on Employee's Work Spirit
papers.journal: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF MULTIDISCIPLINARY RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS
papers.abstract: <jats:p>This study aims to find out the conflict and termination of employment both partially and simultaneously have a significant effect on the morale of employees at PT. The benefits of Medan Technique and how much it affects. The method used in this research is quantitative method with several tests namely reliability analysis, classical assumption deviation test and linear regression. Based on the results of primary data regression processed using SPSS 20, multiple linear regression equations were obtained as follows: Y = 1,031 + 0.329 X1+ 0.712 X2.In part, the conflict variable (X1)has a significant effect on the employee's work spirit (Y) at PT. Medan Technical Benefits. This means that the hypothesis in this study was accepted, proven from the value of t calculate > t table (3,952 < 2,052). While the variable termination of employment (X2) has a significant influence on the work spirit of employees (Y) in PT. Medan Technical Benefits. This means that the hypothesis in this study was accepted, proven from the value of t calculate > t table (7,681 > 2,052). Simultaneously, variable conflict (X1) and termination of employment (X2) have a significant influence on the morale of employees (Y) in PT. Medan Technical Benefits. This means that the hypothesis in this study was accepted, as evidenced by the calculated F value > F table (221,992 > 3.35). Conflict variables (X1) and termination of employment (X2) were able to contribute an influence on employee morale variables (Y) of 94.3% while the remaining 5.7% was influenced by other variables not studied in this study. From the above conclusions, the author advises that employees and leaders should reduce prolonged conflict so that the spirit of work can increase. Leaders should be more selective in severing employment relationships so that decent employees are not dismissed unilaterally. Employees should work in a high spirit so that the company can see the quality that employees have.</jats:p>

papers.title: Not all Analysts are Created Equal: Evidence from Seasoned Equity Offerings
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Cette √©tude examine le comportement des analystes financiers face √† la gestion des chiffres comptables, en se concentrant sur les offres d'actions secondaires, o√π une gestion significative √† la hausse des r√©sultats financiers est souvent soup√ßonn√©e. Les analystes sont class√©s en deux groupes : ceux qui privil√©gient l'exactitude (en alignant leurs pr√©visions sur les r√©sultats d√©clar√©s) et ceux qui favorisent l'informativit√© (en pr√©voyant les r√©sultats non g√©r√©s ou refl√©tant la v√©ritable performance de l‚Äôentreprise). En analysant 1 733 offres d‚Äôactions en Europe entre 2000 et 2016, l‚Äô√©tude r√©v√®le que les analystes informatifs r√©visent leurs pr√©visions √† la baisse apr√®s l'annonce des offres, tandis que ceux recherchant l'exactitude maintiennent leurs pr√©visions inchang√©es. Les analystes informatifs ajustent davantage leurs pr√©visions pour les entreprises pr√©sentant une probabilit√© accrue de gestion des chiffres comptables, notamment celles avec des accruals discr√©tionnaires √©lev√©s ou des √©missions de grande envergure. Les r√©sultats soulignent l'influence des caract√©ristiques des entreprises et des pr√©visions sur ces comportements diff√©renci√©s. Par exemple, les grandes entreprises et celles suivies par de nombreux analystes voient une r√©duction moins marqu√©e des pr√©visions informatives, en raison d‚Äôune moindre probabilit√© de gestion des chiffres comptables. Par ailleurs, la directive europ√©enne sur les abus de march√© (MAD) a r√©duit les conflits d'int√©r√™ts parmi les analystes affili√©s. Cette recherche enrichit la litt√©rature en diff√©renciant les approches des analystes face aux offres d‚Äôactions et en offrant une nouvelle perspective sur l‚Äôinfluence de l‚Äôinformativit√© dans leurs pr√©visions, ouvrant ainsi la voie √† une meilleure compr√©hension des comportements des analystes financiers.</jats:p>

papers.title: Cross-border supervisory cooperation: a progress report and research agenda
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Dans un monde de march√©s financiers int√©gr√©s et de banques transfrontali√®res, les superviseurs nationaux sont confront√©s √† des informations limit√©es et √† des incitations biais√©es, ce qui peut exacerber la fragilit√© financi√®re. M√™me si les autorit√©s de contr√¥le ont commenc√© √† coop√©rer au-del√† des fronti√®res, cette coop√©ration reste largement en de√ß√† d‚Äôune surveillance supranationale comme dans la zone euro. Cet article r√©sume les recherches th√©oriques et empiriques r√©centes dans ce domaine ; il pr√©sente des donn√©es sur la coop√©ration en mati√®re de surveillance transfrontali√®re, montre l'impact (limit√©) sur la stabilit√© d'une telle coop√©ration et les r√©actions des groupes bancaires mondiaux √† une coop√©ration accrue en mati√®re de surveillance.</jats:p>

papers.title: The Market Timing of Mergers and Acquisitions ‚Äì Evidence from Ramadan
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Nous √©tudions les strat√©gies de timing de march√© par les dirigeants d'entreprise. Pendant le Ramadan, la sur√©valuation per√ßue des entreprises peut inciter les dirigeants √† choisir cette p√©riode pour r√©aliser des acquisitions. Nous constatons que, conform√©ment √† l'hypoth√®se de timing de march√©, l'activit√© cumul√©e des fusions et acquisitions est plus √©lev√©e en moyenne pendant le Ramadan, les dirigeants sont moins susceptibles d'√©couter le march√© et la performance post-acquisition est plus faible. Des analyses suppl√©mentaires montrent des r√©sultats diff√©rents pour les trois principaux pays de fusions et acquisitions de notre √©chantillon. Les r√©sultats pour la Malaisie t√©moignent d'une strat√©gie de timing de march√© d√©savantageuse pendant le Ramadan : pour les transactions annonc√©es pendant cette p√©riode, les dirigeants sont moins susceptibles d'√©couter le march√©, la probabilit√© de paiement en actions est plus √©lev√©e ainsi que la probabilit√© d'ach√®vement de l'op√©ration, et la performance op√©rationnelle post-fusion est moins bonne. En revanche, il n'y a pas de preuve de timing de march√© en Turquie et en Arabie saoudite. Nous sommes amen√©s √† interpr√©ter les r√©sultats pour ces deux derniers pays comme √©tant coh√©rents avec le sentiment religieux conduisant √† des transactions de meilleure qualit√© pendant le Ramadan.</jats:p>

papers.title: Heterogeneity of Family Firms and Carbon Emissions: Which Factors Matter?
papers.authors: Faten Lakhal, Assil Guizani, Florence Depoers, Emna Brahem
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Notre √©tude examine si les entreprises familiales √©mettent moins de carbone que les entreprises non familiales et comment l‚Äôh√©t√©rog√©n√©it√© au sein des entreprises familiales affecte leurs √©missions de carbone. En utilisant un √©chantillon de 308 soci√©t√©s fran√ßaises cot√©es dans l‚Äôindice CAC-All Shares de 2002 √† 2020, nous constatons que les entreprises familiales sont plus susceptibles de r√©duire leur empreinte carbone que les entreprises non familiales. Cependant, le comportement carbone des entreprises familiales n‚Äôest pas homog√®ne. L‚Äô√©ponymie familiale influence n√©gativement les √©missions de carbone. √âtonnamment, l‚Äôeffet du stade g√©n√©rationnel familial est positif, sugg√©rant que les entreprises familiales des premi√®res g√©n√©rations sont plus vertueuses que celles des g√©n√©rations suivantes. Des tests suppl√©mentaires d√©montrent que la pr√©sence des fondateurs en tant que PDG ou pr√©sident de conseil d‚Äôadministration est associ√©e √† la r√©duction des √©missions carbone. Nous montrons √©galement que l‚Äôinnovation verte, la pr√©sence de l‚Äôentreprise dans un secteur polluant, l‚ÄôAccord de Paris et la loi sur la transition √©nerg√©tique en 2015 ont renforc√© les r√©ductions d‚Äô√©missions des entreprises familiales. Enfin, nous soutenons que l‚Äôengagement √† r√©duire les √©missions de carbone est un facteur d‚Äôaugmentation de la valeur des entreprises familiales.</jats:p>

papers.title: Debt and Wages: The Role of Labor Regulation
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Dans cet article, nous √©tudions la mani√®re dont la r√©mun√©ration des salari√©s est influenc√©e par l‚Äôeffet crois√© de la r√©glementation du travail et de l‚Äôendettement financier des entreprises. La dette tend √† augmenter le risque de licenciement des employ√©s et √† diminuer leur pouvoir de n√©gociation, alors que la r√©glementation du travail a les effets inverses. L‚Äôhypoth√®se centrale de l‚Äôarticle est qu‚Äôun durcissement de la r√©glementation du travail induit un effet mod√©rateur de la dette sur les salaires. Nous testons cette hypoth√®se sur un large √©chantillon d‚Äôentreprises de l‚ÄôOCDE sur la p√©riode 1990-2018 et montrons que la corr√©lation entre la dette et les salaires est syst√©matiquement plus faible dans les pays o√π la r√©glementation du travail est plus protectrice. Une m√©thodologie de diff√©rence de diff√©rences empil√©es (stacked DiD) exploitant les principales r√©formes du march√© du travail sur notre √©chantillon, d√©montre la robustesse de nos r√©sultats. Des tests empiriques compl√©mentaires r√©v√®lent que nos r√©sultats peuvent s‚Äôexpliquer tant par le canal de la prime de risque que celui du pouvoir de n√©gociation. Nous montrons aussi qu‚Äôun droit des cr√©anciers plus fort, une centralisation plus importante de la fixation des salaires et un pouvoir plus fort des syndicats tend √† diminuer l‚Äôeffet joint de la dette et de la r√©glementation du travail sur les salaires.</jats:p>

papers.title: Stock Markets Reactions to Women Appointments and National Culture as a Moderator
papers.authors: Hind Sami, Lo√Øc Dubois, Loredana Ureche-Rangau
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Cet article analyse la r√©action des march√©s financiers √† l‚Äôannonce de la nomination d‚Äôune femme plut√¥t que d‚Äôun homme √† un poste de direction au sein des √©chelons sup√©rieurs d‚Äôune entreprise, et examine le r√¥le mod√©rateur de la culture nationale. √Ä partir d‚Äôun √©chantillon de 16 871 nominations dans 43 pays sur la p√©riode 2002-2019 (post-loi Sarbanes-Oxley et pr√©-Covid-19), nous r√©alisons une √©tude d‚Äô√©v√©nement qui r√©v√®le des variations significatives des r√©actions boursi√®res selon le pays d‚Äôorigine des entreprises. En utilisant les dimensions culturelles du projet GLOBE et des analyses de r√©gressions multivari√©es, nous montrons que la culture nationale influence ces r√©actions. Plus pr√©cis√©ment, dans les cultures collectivistes, orient√©es vers l‚Äôavenir et centr√©es sur l‚Äôhumain, les march√©s r√©agissent positivement aux nominations de femmes. Nous soulignons √©galement que le type de poste pour lequel une femme est nomm√©e joue un r√¥le dans ces r√©actions. Cette recherche enrichit la litt√©rature sur la diversit√© de genre dans les instances dirigeantes en offrant une perspective interculturelle sur l‚Äôimpact du genre des dirigeants sur la r√©action des march√©s financiers. Elle propose des pistes nouvelles pour les chercheurs et les praticiens en mettant en lumi√®re l‚Äôimportance des normes, traditions sociales et pratiques culturelles dans l‚Äô√©valuation des effets de la diversit√© de genre sur la performance des entreprises.</jats:p>

papers.title: The Welfare Costs of Energy Inflation
Uncovering the profile of passive exchange-traded fund retail investors
papers.authors: Mikael Petitjean, Catherine D‚ÄôHondt, Younes Elhichou Elmaya
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Nous dressons le profil des investisseurs individuels qui n√©gocient en bourse des trackers pas-sifs (P-ETF). Nous utilisons les donn√©es d‚Äôenqu√™te et les registres de transactions de tous les clients actifs sur une plateforme de courtage en ligne au cours d‚Äôune p√©riode d‚Äôenviron 10 ans. Il appara√Æt clairement que ces investisseurs ont un profil distinct. La probabilit√© et l‚Äôampleur des investissements dans les P-ETF sont li√©es √† un niveau d‚Äô√©ducation plus √©lev√© et √† une plus longue exp√©rience de n√©gociation. Les investisseurs en P-ETF d√©clarent avoir des connaissances financi√®res plus √©lev√©es, un objectif de rendement moins √©lev√©, une tol√©rance au risque plus faible et un horizon d‚Äôinvestissement plus long. L‚Äôexc√®s de confiance est moins pr√©sent chez eux et les actions qu‚Äôils d√©tiennent sont moins orient√©s vers le march√© domestique. En outre, les utilisateurs de P-ETF les plus actifs d√©tiennent des portefeuilles d‚Äôactions plus concentr√©s et affichent un taux de rotation plus faible dans leurs portefeuilles d‚Äôactions, ce qui sugg√®re l‚Äôexistence d‚Äôun effet de substitution entre actions et P-ETF.</jats:p>

papers.title: Donors talk: The signaling and imprinting effects of giving to social enterprises
papers.authors: Bert D‚ÄôEspallier, Marek Hudon, Susanna Khavul, Ariane Szafarz
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Comment les donateurs doivent-ils financer les organisations de microfinance afin de maximiser leur impact social¬†? Doivent-ils concentrer leurs contributions sur quelques b√©n√©ficiaires ou plut√¥t les r√©partir entre de nombreuses organisations¬†? Nous abordons cette question d√©licate en estimant s√©par√©ment les effets sur les performances sociales du don en tant qu‚Äôacte d‚Äôune part, et du montant donn√© de l‚Äôautre. L‚Äôanalyse s‚Äôapplique √† des organisations de microfinance du monde entier. Prenant appui sur la th√©orie du signal, nous formulons l‚Äôhypoth√®se que le don en tant qu‚Äôacte a plus d‚Äôimpact que le montant donn√©. En outre, nous √©tablissons l‚Äôexistence d‚Äôun effet d‚Äôempreinte ( imprinting effect ) selon lequel les performances sociales persistent m√™me lorsque les dons se tarissent. En d‚Äôautres termes, le niveau accru des performances sociales observ√©es au cours des p√©riodes subventionn√©es se maintient lors des p√©riodes ult√©rieures non subventionn√©es. Il s‚Äôensuit que des contributions diversifi√©es et r√©parties entre de nombreuses organisations peuvent amener le donateur √† atteindre un impact social global sup√©rieur √† celui r√©sultant de contributions concentr√©es sur un petit nombre d‚Äôorganisations b√©n√©ficiaires.</jats:p>

papers.title: Do CEOs Manipulate R&D Expenses to Increase their Bonus? French Evidence
In Business Groups We Trust
papers.authors: Vivien Lefebvre, Ana√Øs Hamelin, Laurent Weill
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Malgr√© la pr√©valence des groupes d‚Äôentreprises dans le monde, le d√©bat sur les raisons de leur existence est loin d‚Äô√™tre clos. Nous √©tudions l‚Äôimpact de la confiance sur la pr√©valence des groupes d‚Äôentreprises. En utilisant des informations au niveau de l‚Äôentreprise sur l‚Äôaffiliation √† un groupe, nous effectuons des estimations sur un large √©chantillon de 259 919 entreprises de vingt-cinq pays europ√©ens. Nous constatons qu‚Äôune confiance accrue est associ√©e √† une probabilit√© plus faible d‚Äô√™tre affili√© √† un groupe d‚Äôentreprises. Nos r√©sultats concordent avec l‚Äôhypoth√®se selon laquelle une confiance accrue diminue les incitations d‚Äôune entreprise √† internaliser les transactions par le biais de l‚Äô√©mergence d‚Äôun groupe d‚Äôentreprises.</jats:p>

papers.title: Mapping the Evolution: A Fifteen-Year Bibliometric Analysis of Finance
papers.authors: Alexandre Renaud, Dejan Glavas, Rapha√´l Maucuer
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Cette √©tude pr√©sente une analyse bibliom√©trique de la revue Finance sur les quinze derni√®res ann√©es (2009-2023). A partir d‚Äôune analyse de couplage bibliographique, nous examinons les sch√©mas de publication, les dynamiques de citation, les th√©matiques de recherche, et les r√©seaux de collaboration au sein de la revue, pour appr√©cier son √©volution et son impact sur la recherche en finance. Nos r√©sultats r√©v√®lent huit clusters th√©matiques : dynamiques des march√©s de capitaux, gestion de portefeuille, √©valuation d‚Äôactifs, liquidit√© de march√©, gouvernance d‚Äôentreprise, dynamiques d‚Äôendettement, finance comportementale, et finance durable. Malgr√© des √©v√®nements √©conomiques majeurs sur la p√©riode, nous observons une relative stabilit√© dans la distribution des th√©matiques de recherche, indiquant un contenu davantage port√© par des agendas de recherche √† long terme que par l‚Äôactualit√© des chocs exog√®nes. Cette analyse met en lumi√®re les opportunit√©s de diversification de la recherche √† travers des espaces de publication √©mergents, tels que la FinTech, les cryptomonnaies, et la finance climatique.</jats:p>

papers.title: Peran Moderasi Financial Access Pada Pengaruh Human Capital Dan Social Capital Terhadap Kinerja UMKM
papers.abstract: <jats:p>Human capital, social capital dan financial access telah diidentifikasi sebagai sumber daya utama yang mempengaruhi kinerja usaha mikro, kecil, dan menengah (UMKM), variabel-variabel ini jarang dipelajari. Makalah ini, oleh karena itu, menguji hubungan antara modal manusia, modal sosial pada kinerja perusahaan dengan akses ke keuangan sebagai moderating variable. 378 UMKM penghasil Batik Jonegoroan digunakan sebagai sampel penelitian. Pemodelan Persamaan Struktural menggunakan Partial Least Square (PLS) digunakan untuk menganalisis data yang dikumpulkan menggunakan sampling area. Hasil penelitian menunjukkan bahwa modal manusia, modal sosial, dan akses keuangan berpengaruh langsung terhadap kinerja perusahaan.Akses keuangan terbukti menguatkan pengaruh dari social capital terhadap kinerja UMKM. Sementara Akses keuangan tidak memiliki peran moderasi pada pengaruh dari human capital terhadap kinerja UMKM. Disarankan agar pengusaha didorong untuk membangun lebih banyak hubungan dalam jaringan mereka. Serta berupaya untuk mendapatkan akses permodalan baik dari perbankan ataupun lembaga keuangan lain karena akses fianancial terbukti memberi dampak positif terhadap kinerja UMKM. Selain itu, lembaga pemerintah dan lembaga keuangan harus menyusun strategi yang akan mengurangi tingkat bunga sehingga UMKM dapat mengakses sumber keuangan.</jats:p>
